title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell slightly to 2,873.90 USD/T on December 15, 2025, down 0.11% from the previous day, while UK aluminum futures rose toward $2,880 per tonne near a one-month high. This movement is supported by improving demand prospects, tight global supply, and China's fresh stimulus measures against its property crisis boosting industrial metals demand. Over the past month, prices have risen 2.06% and are up 12.13% year-over-year.

title: High aluminium prices to lift Press Metal earnings
summary: High aluminum prices are set to drive record profits for Press Metal amid foreign expansions and resilient market conditions. London Metal Exchange prices have strengthened to US$2,800 per tonne, the highest since 2022, supported by supply tightness, while low alumina costs provide a margin tailwind. HLIB Research raised earnings forecasts, maintained a 'buy' rating, and expects continued aluminum deficits into 2026.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance (GBCCA) showcased robotics, AI, deposit return systems and home recycling equipment at Climate Week NYC as technologies to boost aluminium beverage-can recycling and help reach targets of ~100% recycling by 2050 (80% by 2030). The piece highlights how advanced sorting and household-level solutions can unlock lost material streams and accelerate circularity for aluminium cans.

title: Aluminium Giants Hit Major Milestone with Low-Carbon Production
summary: Elysis (Alcoa–Rio Tinto JV) reported scaling its carbon‑free "inert anode" technology to a 450‑kA cell, a step toward commercial low‑carbon aluminium production that could eliminate CO2 emissions from anodes if sustained at scale. The article discusses technical changes (including a vertical cell design), potential climate benefits, and questions about full‑scale cost and sustained operation.

title: CMR Green improves aluminum purity with German Steinert's technology
summary: CMR Green in India adopted Steinert sensor‑based sorting systems (induction, X‑ray, eddy‑current) across its plants to raise recycled aluminium alloy purity and recovery rates, improving operational stability and supporting reduced CO2 emissions versus primary production. The report notes the partnership enhances circularity and positions the firm as a premium recycled‑alloy supplier.

title: GMG Unveils Graphene Aluminium‑Ion Battery That Fully Charges In 6 Minutes
summary: GMG announced a graphene aluminium‑ion battery using aluminium foil substrates and a chloride‑free hybrid electrolyte that reportedly enables very fast charging (full charge in ~6 minutes) and avoids lithium and copper, targeting automotive, grid and specialty applications as it advances toward scale‑up and patents. The story emphasizes potential cost/weight benefits and ongoing work to validate reliability, safety and manufacturability.

title: North American Green Aluminium Summit 2025 — event overview
summary: An event announcement describing the North American Green Aluminium Summit agenda, which focuses on aluminium's role in decarbonisation, recycling, energy transition, advanced recycling technologies and investment/innovation pathways to expand green aluminium capacity in North America. The listing outlines session topics such as post‑consumer scrap recycling, decarbonisation technologies and sustainable supply chains.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel traded flat at 907 USD/T on December 15, 2025, with a slight decline to 905.08 USD/T, down 0.21% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices rose 5.86%-6.08%, and are up 34.09%-34.37% year-over-year. The data reflects trading on a contract for difference tracking the benchmark market.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 16.12.2025
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures Rebar prices listed as flat at 0.00 change on December 15, 2025. Various futures contracts for rebar and other steel products across regions like Turkey, China, Europe, and North America are tracked. The platform offers analyses and comments on industry trends.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] On December 16, the SMM average price for 10-12% high-grade NPI
summary: The SMM average price for 10-12% high-grade NPI fell to 886.5 yuan/nickel unit (ex-factory, tax included) on December 16. Sentiment in the nickel pig iron market dipped amid price declines. This reflects ongoing trends in ferrous metals pricing.

title: Steel Prices in the Second Week of December 2025
summary: In the flat steel segment, Russian hot-rolled coil (HRC) prices stood at USD 415–420 per ton FOB. Chinese cold-rolled coil (CRC) 1 mm prices were reported amid global market updates. The report covers recent steel price movements in key regions.

title: Thyssenkrupp to cut steel capacity, 11,000 jobs in restructuring drive
summary: Thyssenkrupp, Germany's largest steel producer, will reduce its 11.5 million mt steel production capacity to 8.7-9 million mt as part of a restructuring agreement with IG Metall. The plan aims to raise efficiency, cut costs, and pursue carbon-neutral production long-term, including cutting or outsourcing 11,000 jobs. The steel Europe unit is up for sale amid challenges like low demand, oversupply, high energy costs, and cheap imports.

title: Korea to overhaul steel industry, pledges $139 million in specialty steel R&D subsidies
summary: South Korea unveiled plans to overhaul its steel industry, including government-backed production cuts and increased output of high-value specialty steel. The government pledged $139 million in R&D subsidies during a roundtable with steel executives. This addresses weakening exports due to global construction slump and Chinese supply pressures.

title: China, S Korea companies investigated for dumping
summary: Taiwan's Ministry of Finance launched anti-dumping investigations into cold-rolled, flat-rolled non-oriented electrical steel products from China and South Korea. The probe, prompted by China Steel Corp, targets companies like POSCO, Baoshan Iron & Steel, and others amid rising imports harming local industry since 2023. This follows existing duties on stainless steel from the same countries.

title: Nucor's Emissions Targets Certified by the Global Steel Climate Council
summary: Nucor has received certification from the Global Steel Climate Council for its ambitious GHG emission reduction targets, including net-zero by 2050 at 0.116 metric tons of CO2e per metric ton of hot-rolled steel, covering Scopes 1, 2, and 3. The company leverages nearly 80% recycled scrap in its circular production process, achieving one-third the GHG intensity of traditional blast furnace methods. Nucor plans to meet goals through clean electricity, carbon capture, near-zero GHG iron making, and reduced carbon and natural gas use.

title: Strengthening the future: Steel for growth and resilience
summary: The global steel industry is at an inflection point with shifting patterns requiring innovation for growth and resilience amid sustainability pressures. Success involves capturing growth, improving productivity, and delivering sustainable solutions. This aligns with broader decarbonization efforts in materials.

title: Europe Daily News, 15 December 2025
summary: The EU Council adopts a mandate on new rules to protect the steel industry from global overcapacity, supporting sustainability in steel production. The Commission approves a €408 million Spanish State aid scheme for industry decarbonisation, aligning with Clean Industrial Deal objectives. These measures address environmental and market challenges in the steel sector.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper fell to 5.28 USD/Lbs on December 16, 2025, down 0.93% from the previous day, amid weak Chinese economic data including slowing industrial output and declining home prices. Despite this, prices rose to 5.34 USD/Lbs on December 15, up 1.14%, with monthly gains of 7.35%. Futures hovered around $5.3 per pound, pressured by soft demand in China.

title: Supply Shortages Coupled with the Federal Reserve's Interest Rate Cuts Pushed Copper Prices to a 15-Year High
summary: Copper prices rose sharply last week to 93,903.33 RMB/ton as of December 12, a 15-year high, driven by global supply shortages from mine disruptions and a 'pull effect' into the US market. The Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts amplified bullish sentiment. Forecasts predict LME copper above $11,000 per ton in 2026.

title: Copper eases on weak Chinese economic data
summary: Copper prices retreated on December 16, with Shanghai futures down 1.29% to 91,380 yuan per ton and LME three-month copper falling 0.91% to $11,550 a ton, due to weak Chinese data like slowed factory output and declining home prices. This extended a pullback from last week's record high amid AI bubble concerns. A weaker dollar provided some support.

title: Copper Prices Rise on Supply Concerns
summary: Copper prices increased due to potential supply constraints in 2026, with strong demand from Chinese EV and energy sectors offsetting weak economic data like slower retail sales and industrial output. US demand remains robust from AI investments and reduced trade tensions. Other base metals like nickel and zinc declined.

title: Korea Zinc to Build Integrated Smelter; LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Korea Zinc plans to build an integrated smelter, while LME copper prices showed intraday volatility and closed higher on the reported session; the report also notes changes in Chinese spot premiums, secondary copper market activity, and inventory movements that could constrain upside for prices in the near term.[1] The article discusses supply-side selling driven by year-end funding and weaker demand from high prices, and reports recent LME and SHFE inventory figures that affect market balance.[1]

title: Copper Prices Rise on Supply Concerns
summary: Copper prices increased as markets focused on potential supply constraints for the coming year, with ANZ citing persistent disruptions and strong demand—particularly from Chinese imports tied to EVs and energy infrastructure—as supporting prices despite softer macro data from China.[3] The piece also notes weakness in other base metals and contextualizes copper strength with demand from the US (including AI-related investments).[3]

title: US Copper Stakes Additional Claims to Accommodate Future Surface Facilities at the Moonlight-Superior Copper Project
summary: US Copper filed new claims to secure land for future surface facilities at its Moonlight-Superior project as it prepares for a prefeasibility study and permitting; the company projects average annual production of about 60 million pounds of copper if developed and highlights ongoing metallurgical studies leading into a 2026 PFS timetable.[4] The release positions the project as a potential domestic supplier to the U.S. market and outlines recent technical and economic work referenced in earlier studies.[4]

title: World's largest copper mine drives Chile investment
summary: Coverage highlights Chile’s upgraded mining-investment outlook—driven largely by an expansion at BHP’s Escondida—boosting Cochilco’s estimate of mining investment through 2034 and underpinning expectations for future copper production capacity as Chile aims to capitalise on rising global demand.[5] The article links the Escondida expansion to broader investment in copper and lithium projects and cites forecasts of strong long-term copper demand growth.[5]

title: Chile copper mining costs highest in Americas, threatening new investment, report says
summary: A Cochilco report found Chile has the highest copper mining costs in the Americas for medium-capacity processing plants and the second-highest for large-scale operations, which could threaten new investment despite Chile’s large resource base and plans to expand capacity at major mines.[6] The story warns that elevated capital intensity and operating costs may limit the country’s ability to attract greenfield projects even as demand outlook supports expansion.[6]

title: Nickel Futures Drop Amid Oversupply
summary: Nickel futures fell to 14,295 USD/T on December 15, 2025, down 2.22% from the previous day due to persistent oversupply. Global inventories remain elevated, with LME stockpiles exceeding levels that continue to pressure market sentiment. Over the past month, prices have fallen 2.59%, and are down 8.77% year-over-year.

title: On December 16, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: On December 16, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 111,700–117,800 yuan/mt, averaging 114,750 yuan/mt. This represents a decline of 2,650 yuan/mt from the previous day. The drop reflects ongoing market pressures in the refined nickel segment.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of December 2025 at $14,666.67/wmt, down 2.21% from November's second period. Detailed FOB prices by grade decreased across Ni contents from 1.6% to 2.0%, signaling softer pricing amid supply dynamics.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] On December 16, the SMM average price for 10-12% high-grade NPI was 886.5 yuan/nickel unit
summary: On December 16, the SMM average price for 10-12% high-grade NPI fell to 886.5 yuan/nickel unit (ex-factory, tax included). This decline indicates dipping sentiment in the high-grade nickel pig iron market. Prices reflect broader base metals trends amid supply abundance.

title: Nornickel sharply hikes nickel surplus forecasts for this year and next
summary: Nornickel doubled its 2025 nickel surplus forecast to 240,000 tons from 120,000 tons in July, and more than doubled the 2026 forecast to 275,000 tons. The global nickel market remains in surplus due to rapid supply growth, particularly from Indonesia. This outlook underscores persistent oversupply pressures.

title: Nornickel presents metals market review - 15 December 2025
summary: Nornickel forecasts the global nickel market to stay in surplus over 200 kt Ni in both 2025 and 2026. The base-case scenario highlights continued oversupply amid strong production growth. This review aligns with broader market data on elevated inventories.

title: Nornickel sharply hikes nickel surplus forecasts for this year and next
summary: Russian mining giant Nornickel doubled its nickel surplus forecast for 2025 to 240,000 tons from 120,000 tons previously and more than doubled the 2026 forecast to 275,000 tons. The global nickel market has been in surplus for four years due to rapid supply growth, particularly from Indonesia. Nornickel attributes the surplus to continued production expansion outpacing demand.

title: Nornickel expects global nickel market surplus in 2025-2026
summary: Nornickel forecasts a global nickel market surplus exceeding 200,000 tons in both 2025 and 2026, driven by production growth to 3.86 million tons in 2025 and 4.1 million tons in 2026, outpacing demand growth to 3.62 million and 3.83 million tons respectively. Over 66% of output will come from Indonesia, despite recent government measures to curb excess supply. The company notes that only Indonesia's production restraint can balance the market.

title: Nornickel sees continued nickel surplus and tightening copper supply
summary: Global metals producer Nornickel anticipates ongoing nickel market surplus amid rapid supply expansion. The article highlights Nornickel's outlook on nickel dynamics alongside tightening copper supply. It references Indonesia's significant role in nickel production.
